intro: Clidemia cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and it typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. It is an important component of the native flora in Hawaii, contributing to the region's unique biodiversity. Clidemia cuatrecasasii is also known for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
